description: Dive into "Berlin's Hidden Beach Escapes" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Berlin's Hidden Beach Escapes

places.generalDescription: The Strandbad Wei√üensee is a great swimming area located in the district of Weissensee in Berlin. It features a lovely beach, playground, bar and plenty of benches for visitors to relax on. This is an excellent spot for people who want to take a relaxed stroll or enjoy some sunbathing during their stay in Berlin.

sources.snippet: Tourists in Berlin usually stay in those districts, that are hip and known and full of other tourists. As a true Berliner, who grew up in the beautiful district of Wei√üensee in the Eastern part of Berlin, I can tell you that the German capital has more to offer. In Wei√üensee you find the ‚ÄúStrandbad Wei√üensee,‚Äù which is located right at the lake and is a great beach bar in Berlin.
sources.shortName: FUN Beach Bars in Berlin to Check Out!

places.name: Strandbad Wei√üensee

reviews.text: Sadly, no fishing allowed here (and honestly, probably for the best), but walking around the lake with leaves falling and a local grandpa playing the harmonica? Pure cozy vibes. For a moment, you forget you're in Berlin and feel like you're on a peaceful countryside escape. Simple, charming, and totally relaxing. A true oasis in the neighborhood!

Bad weather, completely empty, late afternoon and they try to rip people off with 10 euros entry (per person) in the sand area for a kid to go down the slide twice. After we ate and had overpriced drinks there. Unbelievable and unacceptable.
I hope this goes bust, change in concept (and ownership) would be refreshing. Ah yes, also rude.

In a city like Berlin it's a luxury to see some water, take a bath, have a nice drink and (at least at the moment) there is a food truck selling some nice pizza. All of this quite close to the center of the city. Weisensee it's still just a few tram stops from Alexanderplatz - I guess that takes around 20mnts - and it offers a great relaxing time! It's one of my escape places. When the sun shines, it's a great pick!

places.generalDescription: BeachMitte, located in the Berlin-Mitte district, is a vibrant hub for beach volleyball enthusiasts and leisure seekers alike. With nearly 50 modern beach volleyball courts, a heated dome for winter games, and a high ropes course, this large inner-city beach area offers diverse recreational opportunities. Visitors can also enjoy the variety of beach bars and open-air terraces while soaking up the sun.

sources.snippet: Whether you're looking for a friendly game of beach volleyball or a relaxed afternoon with beers and music, Beach Mitte in the district of Berlin-Mitte is the perfect spot. The site is home to almost 50 modern beach volleyball courts, a high ropes course and a variety of beach bars and open-air terraces. Located in the center of the capital and just a few minutes away from Hauptbahnhof, this large artificial inner-city beach area unites sports fans and sun seekers.
sources.shortName: Beach Bars

sources.snippet: Auf Dich warten √ºber 45 moderne Beachvolleyball-Felder, ein atemberaubender Hochseilgarten und eine Vielzahl an BeachBars und Openair-Terrassen. Das gr√∂√üte innerst√§dtische Strand-Areal erreichst Du in nur wenigen Minuten vom Berliner Hauptbahnhof. Entdecke die vielseitigen M√∂glichkeiten auf BeachMitte und verbringe unvergessliche Stunden am Strand.
sources.shortName: Willkommen am Strand auf

sources.snippet: One of the trendiest beaches in Berlin is the urban oasis of Beach Mitte. Located in the heart of the city, this man-made beach offers visitors the perfect escape from the urban bustle. The beach boasts a unique design, with imported sand from the Baltic Sea and plenty of stylish amenities.
sources.shortName: Discover The Best Berlin Beaches For Your Summer Vacation!

places.name: BeachMitte

reviews.text:
Beach Mitte is an amazing spot for both beach volleyball and padel the courts are top-notch and really well maintained. Whether you're going for a competitive game or just some casual fun, it's the perfect setting.

What really sets this place apart is the relaxed and vibrant atmosphere. They serve delicious breakfast bowls (a must-try!) and you can enjoy a refreshing cocktail while soaking up the sun. It's also super family-friendly a great place to bring the kids and enjoy a sunny day out.

Love spending my summer days here. A perfect mix of sport, chill, and good vibes. Highly recommend!

Really fantastic place for beach volleyball, big and clean, with toilets and showers. Many courts for sports activities.
Don't forget to chill out after your session with a cold beer and some food. Bar was good and they made hall ready for Xmas party.
I come here regularly. Amazing huge place full of volleyball courts! Also there‚Äòs a bar where drinks and snacks served so also good for hanging out after a game!

places.generalDescription: Krumme Lanke is a popular swimming spot in Berlin, located on the edge of Grunewald. The lake offers pristine waters and unspoiled nature, attracting crowds of locals during warm summer days. It features multiple swimming spots and a secluded nudist beach for those seeking privacy. Visitors can enjoy a jogging track around the shore and take leisurely walks amid pine trees.

sources.snippet: As anyone who‚Äôs been here during summer will know, Krumme Lanke is no longer an insider tip for swimming in Berlin. The small lake sits on the edge of Grunewald and boasts very good water quality and unspoiled nature, meaning hordes of Berliner descend on its shores on warm summer days. A few minutes‚Äô walk in the direction of the Krumme Lanke U-Bahn station, however, you‚Äôll find a second beach that is smaller, shadier and more secluded.
sources.shortName: Beaches in Berlin: The best spots for sun, sand and swimming

sources.snippet: Named for its curved shape, Krumme Lanke is part of Germany‚Äôs Grunewald chain of lakes. This bathing lake known for its pristine waters has several swimming spots, as well as a nudist beach that is perfect for skinny dipping. There is a boardwalk that encircles the lake and provides visitors with the opportunity to go for a walk or jog among nature on sunny days!
sources.siteName: CuddlyNest Travel Blog | Unique Experiences and Travel Inspiration
sources.shortName: The 9 Best Lakes in Berlin, Germany

sources.snippet: Nestled in Grunewald Forest, Krumme Lanke is a hidden gem that appeals to both locals and visitors. Its excellent water quality and natural beauty make it a favored spot for swimming and sun-soaked days. The smaller, more secluded beach nearby offers a quieter and more intimate experience, perfect for those seeking tranquility.
sources.shortName: The 10 Best Beaches in Berlin |

sources.snippet: Nestled within Grunewald Forest‚Äôs verdant environs lays a scenic gem intriguingly. Renowned for its winding coastline and ease of access from the neighboring communities of Dahlem and Zehlendorf via foot or underground railway. The picturesque waters draw an array of nature enthusiasts throughout Berlin‚Äôs suburbs.
sources.shortName: Explore 6 of the Best Lakes and Beaches in Berlin 2024

sources.snippet: This long, narrow lake on the edge of Grunewald Forest in Zehlendorf was appropriately named, due to its crooked, curved shape. On sunny days, its long, green shore path attracts not only bathers but also many walkers, joggers, and cyclists. The water is easily accessible almost everywhere.
sources.shortName: These lakes and outdoor pools are loved by the gay, lesbian, and queer community in Berlin.

sources.snippet: Krumme Lanke is a popular spot not just for walkers and joggers; in summer, the crowds of swimmers settle in on the lawns for a day of fun in the sun.
sources.shortName: Lakes & beaches | visitBerlin.de
Berlin's Best Lakes

places.name: Krumme Lanke

reviews.text: Clean lake. Great to swim on a summers day. Not much around so bring snacks.
Beautiful lake for swimming surrounded by lots of trees. Great place to spend the day at!

Great Place for swimming, relaxing and having fun with friends and families.

NB: The water is really clean and clear!

places.generalDescription: YAAM, short for Young African Art Market, is an iconic riverside beach club and outdoor event location in Friedrichshain. The venue offers a chill vibe with reggae music, African cuisine, and sandy beaches that transport visitors to a Caribbean atmosphere. It features basketball and volleyball courts, live concerts, and DJ performances. With its authentic African ambiance, YAAM welcomes people from all walks of life to enjoy drinks, African dishes, and sports activities like table tennis.

sources.snippet: This iconic club, beach bar and outdoor event location Yaam in the district of Friedrichshain has kept its chill vibe going even after its relocation. Yaam stands for Young African Art Market, and that's exactly what you'll get: Reggae music streams through the speakers, African food fills empty stomachs, and the sand under your feet makes you feel like you're in the Caribbean on a hot summer day instead. Address: An der Schillingbr√ºcke 3, 10243 Berlin
sources.shortName: Beach Bars

sources.snippet: For kick-back Caribbean cool, look no further than Friedrichshain‚Äôs YAAM (Young and African Arts Market). Step through the graffiti‚Äôd garage door and settle into one of the shaded Spree-side seats for Jamaican brews and street-style staples like jerk chicken and black bean wraps. There‚Äôs a fab line up of activities from weekend flea markets, dance classes and poetry slams to late night DJ sets and hip hop concerts.
sources.shortName: 4 of Berlin‚Äôs Best... Beaches?

sources.snippet: One of the best beach bars in Berlin is located in the Friedrichshain district right on the edge of the River Spree. Standing for Young African Art Market, this space was created by expats and nomads from Ghana, Jamaica, and Africa. Inside you will find vendors selling art, Caribbean and African-influenced food stands, drinks, live music, and a sandy beach and hang out spot.
sources.shortName: FUN Beach Bars in Berlin to Check Out!

places.name: YAAM

reviews.text: Totally loved it here, our vibe. Reggae tunes, DJs, beer and food. Just brilliant, again the weather was great, the tunes were excellent and the beer was cold, loved it!

I've never been here at night, so I don't know what it's like as a club, but I have been here during the day.

When you enter they search your bags for food and drinks and unfortunately make you throw away (or consume) whatever you brought.

In my case I just had a transparent water bottle which I had to empty.

It was my choice to do it and enter of course but I think it's a bit rude to ask people to empty water bottles.

I understand they don't want me to bring drinks or food inside but really - it's just water and they are not the Airport security.

I will obviously consume something inside (as I did) but I also want to keep my water for the rest of the day and not buy a new bottle and create more Plastic consumption and pollution.

In addition, they ask for a "donation" of 1-5 EUR to enter which was also a bit absurd after they made me waste water.

The place itself:
is nice as it's close to the river and you have an area with sand and with beach chairs you can relax in.

In conclusion:
If you come without any drinks and don't mind paying the donation - it's a cool place.

For me - because I was with a friend who wanted to go I also went with him but I won't come again now that I know what to expect at the entrance.

Enjoy.

YAAM Berlin mixes beach vibes, great music, and Afro-Caribbean food right by the river. It's lively, welcoming, and full of creative spirit. Ideal for a relaxed day or night out with friends. Worth a visit!

places.generalDescription: Badeschiff is a seasonal floating swimming pool located on the Spree River, offering a unique experience for both locals and visitors. It provides stunning views of East Berlin, including iconic landmarks like the Fernsehturm and the Molecule Man sculpture. Adjacent to the East Side Gallery, it offers access to the world's longest open-air mural collection. The pool itself is housed in an old cargo container and features a beach bar, making it a popular spot for leisure and relaxation.

sources.snippet: Fill an old cargo container with water, toss it in the river in an ex-industrial ‚Äòburb, et voila ‚Äì you‚Äôve got a floating swimming pool slash beach bar that‚Äôs a bonafide fave of savvy locals and visitors alike. The 32m ‚Äòbathing ship‚Äô has been making waves since 2004 and continues to offer ace views of the Oberbaumbr√ºcke. All-day Escobar is on hand for grilled goodies and craft drafts, then as the day ends, the party starts at beat buster Club Arena.
sources.shortName: 4 of Berlin‚Äôs Best... Beaches?

sources.snippet: In keeping with the turn-of-the-century tradition of river swimming pools, the Badeschiff in the district of Treptow is a floating outdoor pool on the Spree river. In summer, you can not only swim here but also enjoy a cool drink at the beach bar and take in the unbeatable view of the Oberbaum Bridge and the TV Tower. Address: Eichenstra√üe 4, 12435 Berlin
sources.shortName: Beach Bars

sources.snippet: Another great beach bar in Berlin is Badeschiff located along the River Spree near Club der Vision”ìre. This is an actual ‚Äúbeach bar‚Äù as they have a sandy platform with lounge chairs that make you feel like you‚Äôre on a real beach. You can rent stand up paddle boards from here or bathe in the sun to music with a drink.
sources.shortName: FUN Beach Bars in Berlin to Check Out!

sources.snippet: When you think of Berlin, beach vibes might not be the first thing that comes to mind. However, the city has a surprising number of options for sun, sand, and fun in the water. One of the most unique and exciting Berlin beaches is Badeschiff.
sources.shortName: Discover The Best Berlin Beaches For Your Summer Vacation!

sources.snippet: Badeschiff: This is a floating swimming pool on the River Spree, located in the trendy area of Kreuzberg. Next to the pool, there's a sandy beach area with hammocks and a bar.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches Near Berlin - BeachAtlas

places.name: Badeschiff | Freizeit Bad

reviews.text: Book in advance and follow the time table, you have time to go in and leave. Pool has no heat (obviously) but was ok, they said around 20¬∞C on June. I liked the experience, nice vibe, well organized.

The best way to feel the summer in Berlin! üåû
A pool floating on the River Spree üíôabsolutely spectacular! I couldn't believe I was swimming and sunbathing like this‚Ä¶ right in the middle of Berlin.

Located in vibrant Kreuzberg, I got there on foot, which made the experience even more enjoyable. The vibe is laid-back and summery, perfect for a relaxing break in the city.

Make sure to book your slot in advance (around ‚Ç¨8 for 2 hours) üòâit's totally worth it. The area is spacious, with a beach bar atmosphere, food and drink service, and beautiful views of the Spree, with the Molecule Man sculpture in the background.

After a mandatory shower, you can dive into the refreshing 23¬∞C water. The pool is up to 2 meters deep, but has shallower edges for more comfortable swimming and lounging.

In case you wanna take public transport:
The nearest S‚ÄëBahn station is Treptower Park, about an 8-minute walk away. You can also take a bus to Heckmannufer, just 5 minutes from the venue.

I absolutely loved it.
A unique summer experience in Berlin  ‚òÄÔ∏èwould go again in a heartbeat! üèäüèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

Highly Regulated and Not So Fun:
If you're looking for a relaxing day at the pool, this isn't it. This place feels less like a fun day out and more like a highly regulated, bureaucratic "German experience." While the pool itself is impressive, the strict rules and a frustrating booking process take all the enjoyment away.
The biggest issue is the extremely limited access. You can only purchase tickets online exactly two days in advance, and you're locked into a rigid 1.5-hour time slot. If you're hoping to swim more than that, you're out of luck. The system is so strict that you can't even enter before your designated time.
Once you're finally in, you'll find even more restrictions. The water is surprisingly cold, and you're not allowed to take photos from the pool deck-for no stated reason. It feels like they've gone out of their way to make the entire experience as restrictive as possible.
Overall, the beautiful pool is completely overshadowed by the complex rules and lack of flexibility. It's a shame, because it could be a great place. But in its current state, it's simply not worth the hassle.

places.generalDescription: M√ºggelsee, the largest lake in Berlin, is a popular destination for locals and tourists alike during the summer months. Spanning almost 3 square miles, it offers scenic surroundings with forests on two sides and three different beaches to choose from, including a nudist section. The lake provides ample opportunities for swimming, sunbathing, and hiking along its tree-lined and reed-covered edges.

sources.snippet: Berliners swarm the city‚Äôs outdoor spaces in the summer, and M√ºggelsee has long been a crowd favorite: It‚Äôs a popular spot to pass an afternoon when a short Ryanair hop to the Italian coast isn't in your weekend plans. Of course, this is an inland lake and not the sea, but it‚Äôs a respite on hot, AC-less days for city residents. Berlin's largest lake approaches almost 3 square miles and is often referred to as the Wannsee of East Berlin, with forests on two sides and three different beaches to choose from (including a nudist stretch, in keeping with the still-popular Freik√∂rperkultur tradition).
sources.shortName: M√ºggelsee ‚Äì Lake Review

sources.snippet: Officially Berlin‚Äôs largest lake, MuÃàggelsee in the east is over 4km (2.5 miles) long and 2.5km (1.5 miles) wide, so hiking around the lake is a great way to stretch your legs. If you‚Äôre planning to do the whole circuit, you‚Äôll have to take the tiny ferry between M√ºggelwerder and M√ºggelhort, which runs once an hour in summer; the crossing takes 10 minutes. Once over, follow the lake around, and after 30 minutes, you‚Äôll come to a lovely beer garden.
sources.shortName: 5 Best Bathing Lakes in Berlin for Wild Swimming

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre looking for a break from the city and a chance to immerse yourself in nature, M√ºggelsee is an excellent choice for your beach vacation in Berlin. Located in the southeast of the city, this picturesque lake is surrounded by lush forests and offers a serene escape from the bustle of Berlin‚Äôs streets. M√ºggelsee‚Äôs sandy beaches are perfect for sunbathing and swimming, and the surrounding area offers plenty of opportunities for outdoor activities like hiking and cycling.
sources.shortName: Discover The Best Berlin Beaches For Your Summer Vacation!

sources.snippet: Down in the south-east of the city, M√ºggelsee is Berlin‚Äôs biggest lake and is surrounded by hiking and cycling trails, and even a range of ‚Äúmountains‚Äù (low, lumpy hills). There is an official bathing beach here, with changing facilities, food stalls and an entry fee, but explore the lakeshore on the other side of the historic Spreetunnel and you can find loads of places to get into the water with plenty of trees and bushes to change behind.
sources.shortName: Our Favourite Swimming Spots in Berlin

sources.snippet: The Wannsee of East Berlin - that is Lake M√ºggelsee, which is also Berlin's largest lake. Here you can feel sand between your toes, play beach volleyball and eat delicious fries. The lido is also great for families with children, as there is a playground and a huge shallow water zone - which is of course also great for water games.
sources.shortName: Top 11 Lakes for Swimming in Berlin

sources.snippet: The M√ºggelsee remains one of the top summer retreats in the city. Located amidst a nature reserve in the Treptow-K√∂penick district, Berlin‚Äôs largest lake offers visitors plenty of leisure opportunities that go way beyond swimming. Water sports lovers, for instance, can enjoy scenic canyoning and paddling sessions on the lake.
sources.siteName: CuddlyNest Travel Blog | Unique Experiences and Travel Inspiration
sources.shortName: The 9 Best Lakes in Berlin, Germany

sources.snippet: M√ºggelsee is a true aquatic playground, offering a variety of water activities, including motor boating, yachting, canoeing, and even floating on colorful lilos. Its expansive waters and vibrant atmosphere create a lively environment for those who enjoy being out on the water.
sources.shortName: The 10 Best Beaches in Berlin |

sources.snippet: What for the West Berliner is the Wannsee is for the East Berliner the M√ºggelsee. Bathing, paddling and hiking have been done here all along. The lake counts, especially in summer, to one of the most popular excursion destinations of Berlin.
sources.shortName: Lakes & beaches | visitBerlin.de

sources.snippet: Take the S9 to Adlershof where you can catch tram 61 toward Rahnsdorf. Stops include Licht- und Luftbad M√ºggelsee and Strandbad M√ºggelsee.
sources.shortName: Berlin's Best Lakes
Best Beaches Near Berlin - BeachAtlas

places.name: M√ºggelsee

reviews.text: I visited this place 3 times and I enjoyed the serenity and the atmosphere every time. The spreetunnel, the boatride, the drinks and the hiking trail in the island all are recommended.
Love it here, amazing lake! Big and has many places to see. Beach can get crowded, though.
Had great time was cute lake day, bit crowded on the small private beaches so need to walk a little but it is a nice route

places.generalDescription: Gro√üer Wannsee, located in the southwest of Berlin, offers a perfect escape from the city with its lush green woodlands and a stunning lake. The area features yachting clubs, cultural sights, and a charming caf√© overlooking the water. Visitors can enjoy a half-mile-long sandy beach at Wannsee lido, complete with wicker beach chairs and a nudist area. Boat cruises across Berlin's lakes start from this picturesque location.

sources.snippet: Now it's on small paths down to the Havel and on towards the Gro√üer Wannsee. The route leads through the idyllic forest, under the Avus, to the Schlachtensee and further along the Krumme Lanke back to the starting point, the free car park in Berlin's Grunewald.
sources.shortName: 10 Best beach trails in Berlin

places.name: Gro√üer Wannsee

reviews.text:
The serene views of the water, especially during sunset, are breathtaking and create a perfect atmosphere for relaxation. Whether you're enjoying a peaceful moment on the shore or engaging in activities like badminton by the water, the setting adds so much beauty to the experience.

The calm water reflects the changing colors of the sky, creating picturesque moments that feel almost surreal. It's an excellent spot for both nature lovers and those seeking a quiet escape. The presence of swans gracefully swimming adds a magical touch to the lake's tranquility. Overall, Gro√üer Wannsee is a must-visit for anyone looking for peace and scenic beauty by the water!
What an amazing View üëè ü§© The boat is free , I mean if u have Deutschland tickets you don't have to buy any tickets extra . Must try atleast once.
Went to see the villa the ‚Äòfinal solution' was signed. Really hard-hitting and informative. Worth visiting

places.generalDescription: Nestled in a residential area of East Berlin, Strandbad Orankesee is a hidden gem offering a family-friendly beach experience. This seasonal beach at Oranke Lake features sandy and grassy areas, beach volleyball courts, and a snack bar. Visitors can enjoy amenities such as changing facilities, food stands, and even a waterslide for added fun. The natural lake has been popular for swimming since 1929 and offers options to rent beach chairs or sun loungers.

sources.snippet: Tucked away in a residential district of East Berlin, the Strandbad Orankesee is a bit of a hidden highlight. A nice big sandy beach with a waterslide, the bathing area (admission fee) has changing facilities, food and drink stands, beach volleyball, table tennis and a huge grassy area to hang out in. There‚Äôs a beer garden on the other side of the lake for when you are done, before you catch the tram back to The Circus.
sources.shortName: Our Favourite Swimming Spots in Berlin

sources.snippet: A natural lake that has been a popular bathing lake with a beautiful sandy beach and green sunbathing lawn since 1929. You can also hire beach chairs, sun loungers and deckchairs here. And all those who enjoy having fun can use the 52-metre-long slide.
sources.shortName: Top 11 Lakes for Swimming in Berlin
Berlin's Best Lakes

places.name: Strandbad Orankesee

reviews.text: Pretty place to chill next to water. Lake is not very big, but the beach area is quite big. There is a nice sand territory, sand was also nice and clean. As well as there is a big green area covered with grass. There is a beach valleyball field and two table tennis. There is also many trees, so you can find lots of shadows. It's a paid swimming place, costs 6 euro for adults, and 3 euro after 17. But be careful, the place is closing at 19. You can buy on territory Pommes, Wurst, some drinks. There are also water guards. In other words, full pack :) Check it out.
There are many beautiful birds

I can't go to Orankesee alone because they have no lockers to keep your bags safe. Otherwise it's a nice beach with a Imbiss for snacks. The water is generally of good quality and they even reduce the price for students and for the last 2 hours of swimming starting at 16:30pm.

places.generalDescription: Strandbad Wannsee, located on the larger of the Wannsees lakes in Berlin, is a popular seasonal lakeside lido offering a range of activities. The beach features white sand imported from the Baltic coast and offers ample space for approximately 30,000 bathers. Visitors can enjoy amenities such as volleyball courts, dining options, boat rentals, and a high-octane playground with a water slide.

sources.snippet: Lie on the sandy beach at Strandbad Wannsee to watch the sailing boats dart up and down the River Havel, and you‚Äôll be partaking in an experience enjoyed by Berliners for nearly a century. The waters of the Wannsee (an inlet of the river) are extensive and, in summer, warm enough for comfortable swimming; there‚Äôs a strong current, though, so don‚Äôt stray beyond the floating markers. Between May and September, there are boats, pedalos and two-person wicker sunchairs, called Strandk√∂rbe, for hire, plus a playground and slides.
sources.shortName: 5 Best Bathing Lakes in Berlin for Wild Swimming

sources.snippet: Standbad Wannse is no doubt one of the best beaches in Berlin. it is one of the largest inland lidos in Europe, with a beach that is 1,275 meters long and 80 meters wide, replenished with sand from the Baltic coast.[ The Wannsee beach is Europe‚Äôs largest outdoor swimming area on an inland body of water. The Wannsee only becomes deep over a very gradual slope which makes it particularly safe for younger swimmers.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Berlin for Tourists to Chill and Sunbath

sources.snippet: More than 50 years ago, Rosa von Praunheim filmed scenes for his classic film, 'It's not the homosexual who is perverted, but the situation in which he lives', at the Wannsee lido. With its 1,375-metre-long and 80-metre-wide sandy beach, this pool boasts of being the largest inland lakeside swimming pool in Europe. This means that there's plenty of space for lounging, sunbathing, and strutting your stuff.
sources.shortName: These lakes and outdoor pools are loved by the gay, lesbian, and queer community in Berlin.

sources.snippet: The Stranbad Wannsee stands proudly amidst Berlin‚Äôs most prized aquatic retreats along the expansive Lake Gro√üer Wannsee. Inaugurated in 1907, this recreational oasis boasts Europe‚Äôs most expansive interior swimming complex, cementing its iconic status amongst locals. Nestled between Nikolassee and the picturesque lakefront, there are over 355,000 square meters of lush greenery and aquatic facilities.
sources.shortName: Explore 6 of the Best Lakes and Beaches in Berlin 2024

sources.snippet: The iconic bathing beach at Wannsee was built over 100 years ago as a place for the workers of the industrial city to relax and cool off in the waters of Wannsee lake, with a huge sandy beach created to that end. It‚Äôs massive but that means it is always possible to find a spot. Nearby you can also rent kayaks, stand-up paddle boards and paddle boats if you fancy exploring the lake a little further.
sources.shortName: Our Favourite Swimming Spots in Berlin

sources.snippet: Situated on the shores of the Gro√üer Wannsee lake, Strandbad Wannsee boasts a lengthy beach with Baltic Sea sand. Its clear waters and safe swimming conditions make it a popular choice for families and individuals seeking a refreshing dip. This beach is a delightful summer destination for sunbathing and picnicking, providing a tranquil escape from the city‚Äôs hustle and bustle.
sources.shortName: The 10 Best Beaches in Berlin |

sources.snippet: This is one of the best beaches in Berlin which is located along the East of the Lake Grober Wannsee. This beach was inaugurated in the year 1907. Strandband features the biggest interior pool in the continent of Europe and with its perfect location in the vicinity of Nikolassee to the south west of Berlin you get incredible panoramic views and soothing winds sailing your way.
sources.siteName: Explore the World with Adequate Travel - Your One-Stop Destination for Travel Planning-adequatetravel.com
sources.shortName: Top 6 Beaches in Berlin

sources.snippet: During the hot Berlin summer, do as the locals and flock to Strandbad Wannsee. Located on the eastern shore of Gro√üer Wannsee lake, a large bay of the Havel river in Berlin, Wannsee features a mile-long beach filled with sand taken from the Baltic Sea as well as several bathing spots. Wannsee is a veritable playground for those seeking to enjoy a sunny afternoon in Berlin.
sources.siteName: CuddlyNest Travel Blog | Unique Experiences and Travel Inspiration
sources.shortName: The 9 Best Lakes in Berlin, Germany

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre looking for a classic beach experience in Berlin, Strandbad Wannsee is the place to be. As one of the largest and most well-known sandy beaches in Berlin, it has been a popular destination for locals and tourists alike since the 1920s. The beach is located on the shores of Wannsee, a beautiful lake in the southwestern part of Berlin.
sources.shortName: Discover The Best Berlin Beaches For Your Summer Vacation!
Berlin's Best Lakes

places.name: Strandbad Wannsee - Berliner B√§der

reviews.text:
The sandy beach is well-maintained and spacious, providing plenty of room for sunbathing and picnicking. The water is clean, perfect for swimming and splashing around.

Facilities include clean restrooms, changing rooms, and food kiosks offering snacks and drinks. There's also a playground for kids and options for beach volleyball, ensuring fun for the whole family.

The surrounding area is picturesque, with beautiful views of the lake and plenty of shaded areas under the trees. It's a great place to relax and enjoy nature. Highly recommended for a sunny day in Berlin!

It would seem positive reviews are based on days of reasonable solitude being part of the offer at Strandbad Wannsee‚Ä¶ in the second / third week of July - rest assured as soon as you ‚Äúcome over the hill‚Äù on the inside patio of the strandbad - you will be facing literally thousands of other swimmers in waiting‚Ä¶ you would be happy to find a private square meter or two.. The water itself is muddy at best. At one point this might have been fine sand from the Baltic Sea - today clay would be a more accurate description - filled with small stones that will have you anxiously waiting for when ‚Äúdisaster strikes‚Äù in the mind of a young swimmer.
The line to the refreshments and snacks would easily top 150 people - unknown to me what would be the time required to pass through til the service window.

Upon our arrival having waited in line somewhat shorter than we feared - the guard tells us that dogs are not allowed (in spite of online info informing that there are several dog friendly seditions ) and she is forced to stay outside in spite of having completed ticket payments just moments ago. No refunds offered in spite of no entry.

All info online as well as IRL seemingly only available in German - which seems less smart in consideration of the fact that locals would presumably be smart enough to stay away this I would suspect overwhelming part of  visitors are indeed foreigners. Hence the fact that the small number of staff visible doesn't seem to speak anything else but German ensures that other visitors like myself really doesn't even have a chance at understanding the few official PA announcements‚Ä¶

There without a doubt will be other options in the Berlin region will you feel that immediate urge to go for a swim,,,

This is a great spot. BUT YOU MUST BRING OFFICIAL PHOTO ID with you. ie passport!!!! NO ENTRY WITHOUT IT. ORIGINALS ONLY. YOU PAY IN. Very easy to get to from Berlin on the train. It is a straight road/path, tree lined walk from the train station at Nikolasse         (Get the S-Bahn, S7) It is a lovely big beach, patrolled with security so it is safe. lifeguards monitor the water. it is very shallow for a great distance out. The water is clean with a mostly sandy bottom. It was warm too they day we went. plenty of toilets. There are beach seats(wicker covered white ones) There is a room to the right of the main steps as you enter (past the food places) room has lockers, but you buy a flag to put on the beach chair to show you have paid. return the flag at end of the day and get your 2euro depoist back. Halbertag is for half a day hire. you can lift and move the chairs but it is a 2 person job. DO NOT BE EXPECTING ENGLISH TO BE SPOKEN-IT IS IN GERMANY AFTER ALL. Didnt use the lockers, or the watersports. but it was nice to chill for a few hours.

places.generalDescription: Sacrower See, located in Potsdam near Berlin, is a hidden gem compared to its more popular counterpart, Wannsee. The lake offers clear and tranquil waters for swimming and boasts stunning views of the surrounding Konigswald forest. With small beaches perfect for groups and families, it's an ideal spot for a relaxing day by the water. Additionally, visitors can enjoy nature trails through the forest and looped walks around the lake.

sources.snippet: Sacrower See is located in Potsdam, just a short train ride from Berlin, and is less frequented than its sister lake Wannsee. The lake isn‚Äôt far from stunning less-known local sights like Peacock Island, and boasts views of the surrounding K√∂nigswald forest, as well as tranquil, clear water to cool off in.
sources.shortName: The Best Secret Swimming Spots In Berlin
Lakes & beaches | visitBerlin.de
Berlin's Best Lakes

places.name: Sacrower See

reviews.text: Lovely lake to walk out run around in pure nature
Beautiful lake to walk around and swim in.
Less crowded than other lakes, great water quality and no boats allowed

places.generalDescription: Sch√∂nwetter Berlin is a unique beach garden nestled in the Mauerpark of Wedding, offering a blend of a beer garden and beach bar experience. The venue features fine sand, soundscapes, light installations, and disco balls that create an urban feel-good atmosphere in the evenings. It's an ideal spot for after-work drinks with its delicious food and refreshing beverages.

sources.snippet: Located inside Berlin's famous Mauerpark, the Sch√∂nwetter beachgarden in the district of Wedding combines the best of a beer garden and a beach bar right in the heart of Berlin. The fine sand, soundscapes, light installations and disco balls transform the beach bar into an urban feel-good place in the evening. Tasty food and refreshing drinks make it the perfect location for some after-work beers.
sources.shortName: Beach Bars

places.name: Sch√∂nwetter Berlin

reviews.text: Outstanding ‚Äúbeach bar‚Äù in the middle of Berlin. Great place to hangout on a Sunday during the flea market üëç
Very nice to people. I didn't have cash on me but gave me drink and i could pay later with money from friend that joined later.

Nice place to sit in the sand and grab a drink.
Lovely staff.

sources.snippet: Located directly on the River Dahme, Strandbad Gr√ºnau offers what its name promises: a wonderful natural backdrop and a marvellous sandy beach. As well as cosy beach chairs, you can hire parasols and sun loungers and even your own cabana. A welcome retreat for anyone who wants to experience even more relaxation and a little touch of luxury for a perfect day at the beach.
sources.shortName: Top 11 Lakes for Swimming in Berlin

sources.snippet: While men and women were segregated at other swimming areas, families got to have fun in the water together at Gr√ºnau. This tradition lives on to this day, and Sunday in particular is an excellent time for family outings to the beach...
sources.shortName: Lakes & beaches | visitBerlin.de

reviews.text: The place is amazing, and the food was so delicious, specially the tostadas of ceviche, so fresh and tasty.
The river water is cold and the nature around is nice, the atmosphere inside is though not my taste.

The place is beautiful.
There was The Medusa Festival and where not too many places to park.

places.generalDescription: Kiessee Schildow is a delightful destination for families looking to enjoy a day by the water. This charming lake boasts shallow swimming areas with gentle lakebeds, making it perfect for young children to splash around safely. Visitors can find ample shaded spots on grassy banks or sandy shores, along with picnic tables for those who wish to dine al fresco. The atmosphere is lively yet tranquil, featuring a nudist area and recreational facilities like volleyball courts and table tennis.

sources.snippet: The Kiessee features several swimming areas that have very flat lakebeds, making this especially well-suited for small children. In addition to a large nudist area, visitors will find a ball field, a beer garden, and table tennis facilities. But even those who seek peace will find a quiet spot to swim somewhere on the lake.
sources.shortName: Lakes & beaches | visitBerlin.de

places.name: Kiessee Schildow

reviews.text: Nice little lake for swimming.  Good spots in the shade with grass or on the sand by the water.  There are picnic tables too if u need them.  The kiosk was well priced and quick to serve.  The water was very clear and shallow a nice distance out for the little ones.

Good location to go by S bhan, but that's where the positives end.

I arrived in the afternoon and had to pay for entry, but it was extremely crowded, with no control over the number of visitors. The lake is small, with limited sandy areas and very few access points to the water.

The water quality was poor, with an unpleasant odor, and the bottom was covered in sharp, uncomfortable plant debris. The swimming area felt cramped, like an overcrowded, enclosed pool, and it was difficult to find a comfortable place to relax. I wouldn't recommend this spot to anyone.

Great lake for swimming, water quality is very ckear. Is quite snall in size and pretty full with mainly young families. They have a little shop that has decent prices for beer, soft drinks and pommes.

places.generalDescription: Deck5 Rooftop Beach Bar is a must-visit spot in Berlin, offering a unique rooftop beach experience with stunning city views. Located on the seventh floor of the Schonhauser Allee Arcaden, this lively hangout features an artificial beach where you can relax on deck chairs or covered cabanas surrounded by palm trees and Buddha statues. Indulge in refreshing cocktails, beers, and delicious BBQ dishes while soaking up the tropical island atmosphere.

sources.snippet: Perched atop Sch√∂nhauser Allee Arcaden (take the lifts to the top floor of the Parkhaus), this view-tiful aerie complete with palm trees and bamboo wrapped cocktail counter pairs cushy white day beds with passionfruit caipirinhas, wood-fire pizzas and perf panoramas. Oh-so deck-adent, indeed. Deck5, 5/F, Sch√∂nhauser Allee 80, Prenzlauerberg, Berlin.
sources.shortName: 4 of Berlin‚Äôs Best... Beaches?

places.name: Deck5 Rooftop Beach Bar

reviews.text:
Always great visiting this rooftop bar.
I love rooftop bars.
There's great views, especially sunset views, good Flammkuchen, good drinks, service was great.

There was a Latin party when we went and entrance fee was 10‚Ç¨. Otherwise on normal days, entrance fee is usually way less.

Great atmosphere and decorations,  there's both indoor and outdoor sitting, dog friendly, and it's on rooftop , so has a nice view. make sure the weather is nice tho, we went during rain and it was a BAD EXPERIENCE. they charge 4 euro entry fees and then after entering they told us that the kitchen is closed so no food is available, we had to just order drinks. the table beside us had to order food online and got it delivered. imagine that! this things they should intimate before getting in.

On the top of the Sch√∂nhauser Alle Arkaden (5th floor, you can take the lift from inside tge shopping center) you can find a very nuce roof top bar. Environment is extremely cool, you can find sand and beach stairs. At dusk the lights are really beautiful. A nice plus, the food is very good. The flammkuchen is excellent. Really nice place

places.generalDescription: D√§meritzsee, located at the meeting point of Berlin and Brandenburg, is a popular destination for locals. The beach comes to life as temperatures rise, attracting visitors from Berlin due to its easy accessibility. While swimming is more convenient on the Brandenburg side with its flatter shores, the lake offers boat trips and fishing opportunities. In autumn, the area's natural beauty shines through, offering serene moments for sunset watching or peaceful walks along the lake.

sources.snippet: Every year, the beach at the D√§meritzsee has its first full weekend on Easter, although swimming's usually not on the agenda just yet. As the temperatures rise, the lawn slowly gets greener, the water warmer, and the beach even more popular with Berliners. After all, it only takes 30 minutes to get from Alexanderplatz to D√§meritzsee with the S-Bahn.
sources.shortName: Top 11 Lakes for Swimming in Berlin

places.name: D√§meritzsee

reviews.text:
(Translated by Google) Idyllic lake near Erkner. Suitable for all kinds of boat trips. But there is also a nice swimming area for swimming in summer below the sports complex in Erkner. The sunsets can be seen all year round (when the weather is clear) from the water and from the shore.

(Original)
Idyllischer See bei Erkner..Geeignet f√ºr Bootsfahrten aller Art .Aber es gibt auch auch ein sch√∂ne Badestelle zum Schwimmen im Sommer unterhalb des Sportkomplexes in Erkner. Die Sonnenunterg√§nge k√∂nnen sich das ganze Jahr (bei klaren Wetter) vom Wasser wie vom Ufer aus  sehen lassen.

(Translated by Google) Wonderfully situated lake that only really comes into its own in the autumn sun. Numerous hiking opportunities in the area mean that visitors can thin out and the places can be enjoyed in their original form.

(Original)
Wunderbar gelegener See, der erst bei Herbstsonne richtig zur Geltung kommt. Zahlreiche Wanderm√∂glichkeiten in der Gegend bewirken, dass sich die Besucher ausd√ºnnen und die Pl√§tze in ihrer Urspr√ºnglichkeit genossen werden k√∂nnen.

(Translated by Google) A small piece of water to visit, there is a bar nearby with drinks and snacks.

(Original)
–ú–∞–ª–µ–Ω—å–∫–∏–π –∫—É—Å–æ—á–µ–∫ –≤–æ–¥—ã –¥–ª—è –ø–æ—Å–µ—â–µ–Ω–∏—è, —Ä—è–¥–æ–º –µ—Å—Ç—å –±–∞—Ä —Å –Ω–∞–ø–∏—Ç–∫–∞–º–∏ –∏ –∑–∞–∫—É—Å–∫–∞–º–∏.

places.generalDescription: Located in the heart of Berlin, Strandbar Mitte is a popular freshwater escape offering access to the city's best lakes and beaches. Situated near iconic landmarks like Museum Island, Alexanderplatz, and Brandenburg Gate, it provides a central location for experiencing oceanic atmospheres within the metropolis. The beach features numerous volleyball courts and is surrounded by galleries offering stunning views.

sources.snippet: As Berlin‚Äôs pioneering freshwater escape, Strandbar Mitte‚Äôs enduring popularity reflects how resourceful visionaries expand local access to the waterfront delights comprising the best lakes and beaches in Berlin. Nestled across from the renowned Museum Island, there are still moments from landmarks like Alexanderplatz and Brandenburg Gate. Few resorts can boast a more central location to experience the oceanic atmospheres in the heart of the metropolis.
sources.shortName: Explore 6 of the Best Lakes and Beaches in Berlin 2024

sources.snippet: If you are hanging around the municipal areas of Berlin, for recreational purposes or not!. You can get a short visit at this popular beach of Berlin that is lined with numerous volleyball courts on the sand and manages various clubs in which all age groups of people come here to play volleyball. Beach is also surrounded by numerous galleries that provide amazing views all around and give its artistic visitors another famous landmark to explore.
sources.siteName: Explore the World with Adequate Travel - Your One-Stop Destination for Travel Planning-adequatetravel.com
sources.shortName: Top 6 Beaches in Berlin

sources.snippet: Strandbar in Mitte is a relaxing beach bar that has comfy deck chairs, palm trees, and great views over the nearby River Spree. It‚Äôs a fantastic place to come and relax after a day‚Äôs shopping in Mitte, or in the evening to watch the sunset over the city. As well as a place to grab a drink or coffee, it‚Äôs also popular with those that like to dance (or want to learn).
sources.shortName: FUN Beach Bars in Berlin to Check Out!

sources.snippet: One of the city‚Äôs oldest beach bars is still one of the best with a svelte stretch of pebbles, deck chairs and front-row views of Museumsinsel. The atmos is more prim than party with sunning and snacking by day, top drops and chilled tunes by night. Culture vultures can also check out the open air amphitheatre which hosts Shakespearean plays and classical concerts.
sources.shortName: 4 of Berlin‚Äôs Best... Beaches?

sources.snippet: Established in 2002, Strandbar Mitte holds the distinction of being Berlin‚Äôs oldest beach bar. Situated along the banks of the River Spree near Museum Island, this urban beach offers sandy expanses, real palm trees, and a vibrant summer atmosphere. It‚Äôs a centrally located haven for beachgoers seeking a lively beach club experience.
sources.shortName: The 10 Best Beaches in Berlin |

sources.snippet: The Strandbar Mitte is a popular beach bar in Berlin and offers real palm trees, open-air tango nights, and cool drinks for a relaxing summer night close to the water. The beach is lined with numerous volleyball courts on the sand. The big number of galleries on the beach provides amazing views all around.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Berlin for Tourists to Chill and Sunbath

sources.snippet: Strandbar Mitte: This beach bar situated along the River Spree provides a sandy retreat in the heart of the city. You won't be able to swim here, but you can enjoy a beach-like atmosphere with cocktails, deck chairs, and even a dance floor.
sources.shortName: Best Beaches Near Berlin - BeachAtlas

places.name: Strandbar Mitte

reviews.text: We went there with a group of 35 people for pizza's and they were so helpful and super chill. The two people who were making the pizza made all 35 pizza within 20 min!! Also the guy behind the bar was so so nice and friendly. It was overall an amazing experience and would def go there again!!

We had a bad experience of really poor service at a Vietnamese restaurant not far from here, so stopped for a water and coke and to give our feet a rest. It was a lovely spot with big umbrellas for shade. Today was particularly hot so it was nice to get out of the sun for a while.
The staff were so friendly too which gave us more reason to stay a little longer.
Well done on creating a good, happy atmosphere in your space by the river.

I've loved coming to the bar for about 20 years now, but the service has sharply declined now. On a Friday night, it was not even 9 pm, the bar man had closed the taps - despite us having our arrival previously announced and agreed that we could stay till 10 pm. So a group of 30 people not only didn't get beer from the tap, the bar man then also suggested that he would close rather soon. Very disappointing!

places.generalDescription: Flakensee, located in Erkner, is a charming lake surrounded by pine trees and offering a tranquil atmosphere. With its white sand beach resembling a small bay, it's an ideal destination for a family beach day. The shallow water along the shore and ample shade from tree branches make it perfect for swimming and relaxing with children. Additionally, Flakensee is popular for boat trips, boasting clean waters and abundant forested areas to explore.

sources.snippet: As the second largest lake in Berlin, the Tegeler Seeattracts with beaches, sailboats and a real promenade. If it's too crowded for you here and you're not afraid to drive a little further, we recommend the Mediterranean feeling at Flakensee. If you walk along the promenade from the Woltersdorfer lock, the scent of the surrounding pine forest makes you think of the Mediterranean.
sources.shortName: Top 11 Lakes for Swimming in Berlin

sources.snippet: Flakensee in Erkner is a cosy lake surrounded by pine trees and measuring seven metres at its deepest point. On the southeastern shore of the lake is a white sand beach like a small bay ‚Äì perfect for a beach day with children. The water along the shore is very shallow for a long time, and tree branches provide plenty of shade.
sources.shortName: Beaches in Berlin: The best spots for sun, sand and swimming

places.name: Flakensee

reviews.text: Beautiful swimming lake. Very relaxing with nice trails and beautiful views.
A good spot to rest and swim with a child
Beautiful lake

places.generalDescription: Pl√∂tzensee is a popular urban lake in Berlin, offering swimming, sunbathing on the beach, and boat rentals. It's located northwest of the city center and is a favorite spot for locals to relax by the water when the sun is out. The lake is surrounded by tree-lined paths and offers a picturesque setting for outdoor activities. Visitors can hire bikes from the city center and cycle to Volkspark Rehberge, a large park with various recreational options.

sources.snippet: As  you relax in the water surrounded by trees, it's hard to imagine that you're actually in the middle of Germany's largest city and had pedalled past factories and the Westhafen port on your way here. The lido at Pl√∂tzensee imbues 1920s chic, like a smaller version of the beach at Wannsee, a bit of the countryside right in the middle of the city. In addition to a small beach there are also extensive lawns.
sources.shortName: Top 11 Lakes for Swimming in Berlin

sources.snippet: Also in the neighbourhood of Wedding, the Pl√∂tzensee lake is a peaceful retreat from the hustle and bustle of the city. You can only swim from the official bathing beach ‚Äì which has an entry fee ‚Äì but in exchange you‚Äôll get places to change, food and drink trucks, beach volleyball and other games, and in recent summers a programme of events long into the night.
sources.shortName: Our Favourite Swimming Spots in Berlin

sources.snippet: From May to August, the Strandbad Pl√∂tzensee in Wedding is open daily from 9 am to 10 pm. The historic open-air swimming pool is one of the most beautiful in Berlin; its entrance building from the 1920s is a listed structure. On the sandy beach there are beach chairs and deckchairs for hire, as well as volleyball courts and table tennis tables.
sources.shortName: These lakes and outdoor pools are loved by the gay, lesbian, and queer community in Berlin.

sources.snippet: When it comes to indulging in outdoor activities, no place is better than Pl√∂tzensee. This Berlin lake is part of a sandy beach filled with sports fields where visitors can play volleyball, football, and table tennis. There are also several green areas and sunbathing laws where people can tan and simply relax.
sources.siteName: CuddlyNest Travel Blog | Unique Experiences and Travel Inspiration
sources.shortName: The 9 Best Lakes in Berlin, Germany

sources.snippet: Pl√∂tzensee is a popular lake in Berlin‚Äôs Wedding district, perfect for a fun day out in the sun. This lake is surrounded by lush greenery and offers a sandy beach area where you can relax and soak up the sun‚Äôs rays. If you‚Äôre looking for water activities, Pl√∂tzensee has you covered!
sources.shortName: Discover The Best Berlin Beaches For Your Summer Vacation!

sources.snippet: On the south side there is a paid area, Strandbad Pl√∂tzensee (4 euro), with attractions for kids, beach volleyball courts, and deckchairs. Food is available and FKK swimmers have their own area.
sources.shortName: Berlin's Best Lakes

places.name: Pl√∂tzensee

reviews.text: I really wanted to say thank you to Lisa a Plotzensee manger for her fantastic support to help us organize summer event for my team. The food was fantastic ( thank you Alex), the service staff, bartenders plus technicians! They all did an amazing job to make sure our event will be on point! We highly recommend this place for any event. We were a group of approx 80 people.

This small lake near Wedding is a great spot for a refreshing swim. While the water quality is decent, it is not exceptional, but still good enough for a dip. It can get quite crowded, but I prefer the wilder side of the lake. There, you will find trees and meadows that offer a peaceful place to sit and relax. Occasionally, you might stumble upon a little rave, adding a unique and enjoyable twist to the experience
Nice beach, nice water , cool peoples. Real Berlin vibes. With new management seems more appropriate for hangouts and swimming also enjoying the culinary scene.

places.generalDescription: Strandbad Jungfernheide is a small lake in Charlottenburg, west of Berlin. It's an artificially created lake within Volkspark Jungfernheide with a big beach area and various amenities such as food stores. While the entrance fee is around EUR 6, it offers a nice place to enjoy the waters during hot summer days. The area features two designated swimming areas and a loop train for walkers, joggers, and dog owners.

sources.snippet: Strandbad Jungfernheide in the western Berlin district of Charlottenburg is the perfect beach holiday right in the city. The white sand beach with beach chairs is the perfect spot for a leisurely picnic. For the younger visitors, there's also a volleyball court and a slide.
sources.shortName: Lakes & beaches | visitBerlin.de

sources.snippet: Located out west in leafy Charlottenburg,this is actually an artificially created lake in the Volkspark Jungfernheide. There are two designated swimming areas and a loopign train around the week for walkers, joggers and doggie joggers.
sources.shortName: Berlin's Best Lakes

places.name: Strandbad Jungfernheide

reviews.text:
Great place to chill out and have a walk. The free beach looks nice but in sunny days is going to be crowded.
Lots of parents with children during the week and younger people in the weekend.
There is also a Biergarten where you can buy some refreshments.
Very nice place!

This place is really good. On a weekday it was not crowded, family friendly, good service, quite & cozy. The beach is clean, no trash or sharp objects on the sand, the water is much cleaners with much less algae than usually berlin beaches. There are showers, changing rooms, toilets, feet washes and volleyball fields.
We rented the beach chairs and umbrella, they are solid and fine, Not the best but quite usable. About The food service: The beer was good and cold, the fries are freshly made and currywurst was delicious & Service was friendly with an english speaker also.
The place is really family friendly, lot's of kids playing and having fun with their parents. And kinda chill for couples and singles too if not too crowded. The bathroom was also clean.
The prices are totally justified in my opinion, the beach is well maintained and prices is good in regard to what you get.
Overpriced. Good sandy beach,old toliets and cold showers. Water is dirty. Cash only, but you can buy tickets online.
